A cyclist travels in a straight line according to x(t) = ( -7 - 6t + t2 ) m, where t is in seconds. (a) At what time does the cyclist reach the origin (x = 0)? (b) What was her starting point (coordinate) at time = 0? (c) How long does it take for her to move from the origin x = 0 to the coordinate x = 10 m? (d) If the velocity of the cyclist changes as v(t) =( - 6 + 2t )m/s , what is her velocity at x = 10m?
